prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: HI-30alpha Line Emission in Sgr A*
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: We propose to measure the HI 26alpha line emission in SgrA* to measure the EUV output of SgrA* and the mass and kinematics of ionized gas near the central 4 million solar mass black hole. This will provide the first measurement of the ionized gas mass and kinematics on subarcsec scales.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: Based on analysis in sec 4.1 of proposal, we estimate a mean HI line flux 3 mjy spread over 1500 km/s width based on the NIR line observations. We target 0.5 mJy rms with 50 km/s resolution. We estimate 100-500 mjy /beam continuum. The HeII line which also falls in this observation will be contaminated by CO emission and we request a separate science goal to do a different HeII line (48alpha).The detection of emission lines on top of the SgrA* continuum will require excellent passband calibration and stability. In consultation with our technical support in preparing Phase 2, we will request that passband calibrations be inserted into the observations at the beginning, middle and end of the SgrA* observations. These two extra passband calibrations should cost no more than 10 minutes of time(inc. overhead).

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: HI-30alpha Line Emission in NGC 1068
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: We propose to measure the HI 26alpha line emission in NGC 1068 to measure the EUV output of this nearby Seyfert II AGN.This will provide the first measurement of the ionized gas mass and kinematics on subarcsec scales in this very dust obscured AGN.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: Based on analysis in sec 4.1 of proposal, we estimate a mean HI line flux 3 mJy spread over 1200 km/s width based on the NIR line observations. We target 0.6 mjy rms with 50 km/s resolution. We estimate < 100 mjy /beam continuum based on OVRO observations. The HeII line which also falls in this observation will be contaminated by CO emission and we request a separate science goal to do a different HeII line (48alpha).

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: HI-30alpha and HeII-48alpha Line Emission in SgrB2M
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Observations will be obtained simultaneously for the HI and HeII recombination lines in the compact HII regions of Sgr B2 to constrain the EUV spectrum and Lymna continuum output of young OB star clusters. These regions should be old enough to contain some W-R stars but also have sufficient surrounding gas that all of the EUV is absorbed.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: The spectral setup here permits coverage of our primary lines H30alpha and HeII48alpha in a single observation. The CO 2-1 line will also be included but based on the expected line width we do not expect significant contamination. The expected HI recombination line flux was estimated from the radio free-free continuum as outlined in sec 3.3 of the proposal. The HI line will be detected and imaged with the fluxes expected from the free-free. The strength of the HeII line line relative to HI will depend on the EUV spectrum (the goal of our project) but we aim to achieve limits ~1/20 or more below HI.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Observations will be obtained simultaneously for the HI and HeII recombination lines in the compact HII regions of Sgr B2 to constrain the EUV spectrum and Lymna continuum output of young OB star clusters. These regions should have sufficient surrounding gas that all of the EUV is absorbed.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: The spectral setup here permits coverage of our primary lines H30alpha and HeII48alpha in a single observation. prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Observations will be obtained simultaneously for the HI and HeII recombination lines in the compact HII regions of Sgr B2 to constrain the EUV spectrum and Lymna continuum output of young OB star clusters. These regions should have sufficient surrounding gas that all of the EUV is absorbed.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: The spectral setup here permits coverage of our primary lines H30alpha and HeII48alpha in a single observation. The CO 2-1 line will also be included but based on the expected line width we do not expect significant contamination. prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: HI-30alpha and HeII-48alpha Line Emission in G332.8254
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Observations will be obtained simultaneously for the HI and HeII recombination lines in the compact HII regions of Sgr B2 to constrain the EUV spectrum and Lymna continuum output of young OB star clusters. These regions should have sufficient surrounding gas that all of the EUV is absorbed.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: The spectral setup here permits coverage of our primary lines H30alpha and HeII48alpha in a single observation. The CO 2-1 line will also be included but based on the expected line width we do not expect significant contamination. The expected HI recombination line flux was estimated from the radio free-free continuum as outlined in sec 3.3 of the proposal. prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: HeII49alpha Line Emission in Sgr A*
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: We propose to measure the HeII 49alpha line emission in SgrA* to probe the ionized gas there and to constrain the hard EUV continuum at > 4 Rydbergs.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: Based on analysis in sec 4.1 of proposal, we estimate a mean line flux of < 3 mjy spread over 1500 km/s width based on the NIR line observations. We target 0.1 mjy rms with 500 km/s resolution. We estimate 100-500 mjy /beam continuum. The detection of emission lines on top of the SgrA* continuum will require excellentpassband calibration and stability. In consultation with our technical support in preparingPhase 2, we will request that passband calibrations be inserted into the observations at the beginning, middle and end of the SgrA* observations. These two extra passband calibrations should cost no more than 10 minutes of time(inc. overhead).

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: HeII49alpha Line Emission in NGC 1068
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: We propose to measure the HeII 49alpha line emission in NGC 1068 to probe the ionized gas there and to constrain the hard EUV continuum at > 4 Rydbergs.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: Based on analysis in sec 4.1 of proposal, we estimate a mean line flux of < 3 mjy spread over 1200 km/s width based on the NIR line observations. We target 0.1 mjy rms with 500 km/s resolution. We estimate < 100 mjy /beam continuum based on OVRO observations.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract:
The extreme ultraviolet (EUV) of starforming and AGN sources cannot be probed directly from the ground or from space; their EUV are thus very poorly constrained. Our recent theoretical work demonstrates that the mm/submm recombination lines of HI and HeII are excellent probes of the EUV: they have little dust absorption, they arise from H and He (thus independent of metallicity) and their fluxes depend linearly on number of EUV continuum photons. The He++ region (producing HeII emission) requires 54 ev photons, thus the EUV hardness is directly proportional to the HeII/HI flux ratio.
We propose observations of HI and HeII in compact OB star regions and galactic nuclei (SgrA* and NGC 1068). These observations will demonstrate the potential of the HI and HeII lines -- opening a new observing window on the EUV. Themeasured hardness of the EUV spectra will provide critical input to starburstsynthesis models. Based on prior near infrared line detections, we confidently expect expect detectios of the line emission in both SgrA* and NGC 1068. In the former, ALMA will image the 10^4 K ionized gas at 0.2 arcsec resolution (0.01 pc radius) for the first time.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:previousProposals: 2011.0.00097.S Evolution of ISM, 2011.0.00175.S Merging IR-Luminous Galaxies
